headline: CNN 10
subHeadline: Destruction in Mississippi After Powerful Storms; A stunning Lineup of Five Planets Will Decorate The Night Sky; Tech Company Wants To Revolutionize Home Delivery Through Drones. Aired 4-4:10a ET

utterances.speaker: ISABEL MORALES, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Powerful storms and at least one tornado pummeled the southeast on Friday night, nearly leveling someneighborhoods and knocking out power for thousands, officials said. The confirmed tornado touched down in Mississippi where the damage and death toll have been most severe. Search and rescue efforts for storm victims began after the tornado struck the towns of Silver City and Rolling Fork.

utterances.speaker: MAYOR ELDRIDGE WALKER, ROLLING FORK, MISSISSIPPI
utterances.sentences: The state of my town, devastation. As I look around, families are affected. Homes are torn up,families are without a place to live, children are hungry, no clothes. We`re devastated.

utterances.speaker: MORALES
utterances.sentences: The city of Rolling Fork is in Sharkey County, the origin of many of the storm fatalities. Mississippi Governor Tate Reeves issued a state ofemergency in all counties affected by the severe storms, according to a release. State agencies let the search for victims and FEMA has arrived to help with the recovery.

utterances.speaker: DEANNE CRISWELL, FEMA ADMINISTRATOR
utterances.sentences: Right now we still are in a lifesaving, life-sustaining mode, and we want to make sure that the statehas everything that they need as we work to make sure that no additional lives are lost. I think as you are watching the images and I`m watching these images, it`s just heartbreaking to see the devastation that this community has sustained.

utterances.speaker: MORALES
utterances.sentences: The tornado that flat of the community of Rolling Fork was rated at a strength of EF-4, according to a member of the National WeatherService team surveying the damage.

utterances.speaker: VICE MAYOR LADONNA SIAS, ROLLING FORK, MISSISSIPPI
utterances.sentences: Even though we lost everything, this stuff can be replaced, material things can be replaced,but to lose a loved one, it was just heart wrenching. (END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Ten second trivia.Which planet most closely resembles Earth in mass and size? Mars, Venus, Neptune or Saturn? Scientists say Venus is most similar in size though its atmosphere is said to be a poisonous inferno. This Tuesday we`re going to be able to look up into the nighttime sky and see a rare phenomenon, a parade of planets and one of them is Venus. Now, it`s more common to be able to see two or three planets in what`s called a planetary parade or planetary alignment. But this time, experts say, we`re going to be able to see five planets at the same time, all lined up beneath the moon in the same part of the sky like pearls on a necklace, they say. They also say that the sky has to be clear and that our best chance to see this planetary parade will be by looking towards the horizon in the west just after sunset. Are you going to be watching? If so, snap a pic and tag me at Coy Wire. Have you ever had anything delivered to your home via drone? The idea of having hovering crafts, dropping packages at our doorsteps has been around for years, but it`s not anywhere near mainstream yet. Because of regulations from the Federal Aviation Agency, or FAA, and because of neighborhood safety and privacy concerns, those are just some of the factors that have hampered companies abilities to deliver any sort of product or food from above. But the race for drone deliveries is heating up, and a fully autonomous home delivery future is closer than ever. The startup Zipline is giving us a closer look at what that future might look like. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) KELLER RINAUDO CLIFFTON, CO-FOUNDER & CEO, ZIPLINE:  What we`ve heard again and again and again is that customers really also want a way of delivering directly to homes. And so, over the last three and a half years, Zipline has been designing all the technology. But behind the scenes, to enable instant autonomous home delivery. They can be less expensive. There`s zero emission, and it`s just a better delivery experience to boot. It`s more reliable, it can operate with higher service level guarantees, and it can serve more homes. Ultimately, we do think it`s quite inevitable that you`re going to see this transition towards these more efficient, faster and zero emission ways of delivering. (END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Do you hate getting up early in the morning? Well, so does Doris. Now, Doris is a dairy cow from England who`s gone viral for being sorelatable to so many snooze lovers around the world. She`ll even pretend to be sleeping while all the other cows get up to go off into the milking machines. We see you, Doris. Milk it for all it`s worth, baby. Jeanne Moos has more. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: JEANNE MOOS, CNN NATIONAL NEWS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Do you hate getting up in the morning? So does Doris. All the cows at Reads Farm on the Isle of Wightin England got up and left for milking.

utterances.speaker: JOHN BRODIE, DAIRY FARMER
utterances.sentences: Except for Doris. Doris is actually pretending to be asleep.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: And for faking sleep, Doris has gone viral. People relate. I am Doris was a typical comment.

utterances.speaker: BRODIE
utterances.sentences: Oh, Doris. Doris has got a fantastic personality. She is definitely more person than cow.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: She`s one of John Brodie`s favorites.

utterances.speaker: BRODIE
utterances.sentences: You`re a mischief maker. Leave my coffee alone, please.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: When Doris pretended to be asleep, John called her out.

utterances.speaker: BRODIE
utterances.sentences: Doris, come on. See your ears moving. Come on. I can see your eye. Yeah.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: How he would know she was faking?

utterances.speaker: BRODIE
utterances.sentences: Around 30 seconds beforehand, she had her head up and was looking straight at me. She put her head back down, thinking that she was going toget away with it just to push her up, be cheeky.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Now Doris has fans online. I think I found my spirit animal. Leave Doris alone. But Doris doesn`t leave John alone.(On camera): And why was she licking the back of your head?

utterances.speaker: BRODIE
utterances.sentences: Um, grooming. She`s grooming me. It means as far as I`m concerned, she`s accepts me as a member of the herd.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: She grooms him. He grooms her.

utterances.speaker: BRODIE
utterances.sentences: This is over your face.(END VIDEOTAPE)
